dt: {bc}having an air of easy {d_link|unconcern|unconcern} or indifference

pt: {sc}cool{/sc} {sc}composed{/sc} {sc}collected{/sc} {sc}unruffled{/sc} {sc}imperturbable{/sc} {sc}nonchalant{/sc} mean free from agitation or excitement. {sc}cool{/sc} may imply calmness, deliberateness, or dispassionateness.
{sc}composed{/sc} implies freedom from agitation as a result of self-discipline or a sedate disposition.

pt.t: the {it}composed{/it} pianist gave a flawless concert

pt: {sc}collected{/sc} implies a concentration of mind that eliminates distractions especially in moments of crisis.
{sc}unruffled{/sc} suggests apparent serenity and poise in the face of setbacks or in the midst of excitement.
{sc}imperturbable{/sc} implies coolness or assurance even under severe provocation.

pt.t: the speaker remained {it}imperturbable{/it} despite the heckling

pt: {sc}nonchalant{/sc} stresses an easy coolness of manner or casualness that suggests indifference or unconcern.

quotes.t: … watch his iron-backed posture as he rides a horse and listen to the {qword}nonchalant{/qword} way in which, not barking but speaking he says "Fire" to the line of infantry, like someone asking for a light.

In those stories, we already find the qualities the world would come to know as "Kafkaesque": the {qword}nonchalant{/qword} intrusion of the bizarre and horrible into everyday life, the subjection of ordinary people to an inscrutable fate.

He and Anita (and an ancient, {qword}nonchalant{/qword} Lhasa apso … ) live in a gated community, surrounded by high, vine-covered walls, redolent of Wrigley, that embrace a golf club and an attractive thicket of large houses …

It was thrilling to watch them, the regulars, so {qword}nonchalant{/qword}, so composed as they slipped from Senate cloakroom to Senate hideaway, sharing jokes with powerful men old enough to be their fathers.

et: French, from Old French, from present participle of {it}nonchaloir{/it} to disregard, from {it}non-{/it} + {it}chaloir{/it} to concern, from Latin {it}calēre{/it} to be warm {ma}{mat|lee|}{/ma}
shortdef: having an air of easy unconcern or indifference
